reporting-org.narrative: Centre for Rights Education and Awareness

description.narrative:
1. Objective 1: To improve access to justice for women and girls by strengthening the institutional response of state and non-state actors to promote and protect the rights of women and girls in Kilifi and Meru Counties by September 2021. To achieve the objective:
The project will facilitate engagements between SGBV sector stakeholders including the County CEC for gender, state department of gender, civil society organizations, women champions, and representatives from women and girl-led accountability groups to strengthen the SGBV referral pathway including coordination of prevention and response mechanisms
2. Objective 2 – To champion positive social-cultural norms, attitudes, and practices that promote the rights of women and girls by September 2021. To achieve the objective:
CREAW engages in mass awareness forums with different sets of community members (Women and Men) and builds their knowledge base and understanding of what constitutes SGBV and the referral pathway of care and support for those affected by violence. Information will be shared using virtual platforms as well as physical spaces with strict adherence to the COVID 19 measures

The project is a one-year intervention, that seeks to strengthen the capacity of the state and by collaborating capacity of non-state actors to respond and address the needs of sexual and gender-based violence survivors. At a global level, the project contributes to the achievement of sustainable goal (SGD) 5 on gender equality and empower all women and girls and the 2030 agenda for sustainable development goal. In addition, the project aims to contribute towards the implementation of key actions for the further implementation of the program of Action of the ICPD as outlined during the Nairobi summit of ICPD 25 held in November 2019. Specifically, the project will focus on contributing towards agenda 5 (a and b) in the Nairobi Statement which seeks to address sexual and gender-based violence and harmful practices, in particular child, early and forced marriages, and female genital mutilation, by committing to strive for; Zero sexual and gender-based violence and harmful practices, including zero children, early and forced marriage, as well as zero female genital mutilation and elimination of all forms of discrimination against all women and girls, in order to realize all individuals’ full socio-economic potential.
the project is aligned to the Netherlands government Human Rights Report 2017 that advances equal rights for women and girls in order to attain gender equality as well as freedom of expression in the usage of online spaces. Survivors of violence shall be encouraged to express their opinions, thoughts and share experiences using virtual spaces including the use of community media as part of interventions. Human rights defenders supporting survivors of violence shall also be involved in the project prioritizing their safety and security as well as enhancing their capacity as paralegals to innovatively operate virtually in the context of the COVID 19 pandemic in ensuring justice is not just seen but served for SGBV survivors. Furthermore, the project is aligned to UN Resolution 1325 that seeks to fight violence against women and girls and child marriage as well as global campaigns such as #Metoo and SheDecides also supported by the Dutch government and the EU Action plan on Human rights and democracy.
The project targets to empower women and girls in order to attain gender equality, freedom of expression in the usage of online spaces

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Rights Education and Awareness

activity-date.narrative: HAKI project started implementation of the project activities in January 2021

description.narrative: County governments in Kilifi and Meru Counties coordinate multisectoral response to GBV response and referral of cases.
Increased community awareness, support and engagement with 10,000 community members on access to justice for SGBV survivors
Public authorities (Police and local administration) in Kilifi and Meru Counties equipped with knowledge and skills to improve institutional response and prevention of VAW/G.

title.narrative: Establishment of probono lawyers and counselors network established

description.narrative: 20-member Pro bono lawyers and 20-member counselors network established to support legal aid, legal representation, and psychosocial support for women and girls survivors of SGBV.

title.narrative: The number of women and girls receiving pro bono legal assistance, advice, representation on GBV cases, and counseling services.

description.narrative: The total number who have benefitted from the legal and psychosocial support offered

dimension.value: Two shelter facility contracted to support GBV survivors with safe space. The shelter has 117 survivors, 90 girls, 7 boys and 20 female adults. and who are adolescent girls all aged under 18years.

comment.narrative: Value is 0 because baseline survey was not conducted

target.value: A virtual online platform within CREAW

comment.narrative: Setting up a virtual platform where survivors get support from the pro bono and legal and psycho social staff.

actual.value: setting up of an operational toll free line within CREAW where survivors seek support.

comment.narrative: A localised hotline was established which supported survivors of violence who called to seek support. Pro bono legal assistance continued to be offered where 47 survivors were given legal advise and 28 received court representation.

target.value: Two safe spaces

dimension.name: Set up of a localised County specific CREAW hotline where survivors of violence can report cases and be supported with legal and psychosocial support.

comment.narrative: A localized CREAW hotline where survivors of violence can report cases and be supported with legal and psychosocial support in place

target.value: Contracting 2 shelter facilities to provide temporary shelter for SGBV survivors

dimension.name: Two safe spaces/ shelters to be contracted to offer support to SGBV survivors

comment.narrative: Survivors of GBV were supported to access GBV services that include accessing the shelters

target.value: one toll free number

dimension.name: This is a platform where survivors of violence call call any day any time to seek for support

comment.narrative: The toll-free line is operational to report any cases of GBV and to seek legal and psychosocial support from professional counselors and lawyers.

target.value: Re-training of 60 paralegals/Community Health Volunteers/Human Rights Defenders (Virtually) on how to support survivors of SGBV access justice including court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic.

dimension.name: Re-training of 60 paralegals/Community Health Volunteers/Human Rights Defenders (Virtually) on how to support survivors of SGBV access justice including court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic.

comment.narrative: The training is to equip the paralegals/ CHVs with knowledge on how to support survivors of GBV access court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic

target.value: Two safe spaces

dimension.name: The shelters will offer support to SGBV survivors and give the a safe space away from the perpetrator

comment.narrative: This is a safe space for survivors to recover emotionally and be safe/ away from the perpetrator

dimension.name: Survivors of violence have used the toll free number to report cases and to seek legal and psycho social support
dimension.value: 245 tele-counseling sessions to SGBV survivors and reffered other relevant service providers within the referral pathway. 445 survivors benefited from online legal advice online

comment.narrative: CREAW launched a Toll-free number (0800-720-186) to support survivors of SGBV

actual.value: Two safe spaces established. Two shelters have been contracted, the shelter has a total of 117 survivors, 90 girls, 7 boys and 20 female adults. Survivors in the shelter have been kept away from the perpetrators and undergone psychosocial sessions to help them carry through the ordeal.

dimension.name: One safe space has been established in Kilifi and one in Meru

comment.narrative: The safe spaces established to offer support to SGBV survivors

actual.value: 14 paralegals and 33 CHVs and 22 community champions were trained on how to support survivors of GBV access court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic

dimension.name: the training was on how to support survivors of GBV access court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic.
dimension.value: 14 paralegals and 33 CHVs and 22 community champions were trained on how to support survivors of GBV access court proceedings in the new context operating with the COVID 19 pandemic.

title.narrative: Improved multisectoral coordination and monitoring of SGBV in Kilifi and Meru Counties.

description.narrative: Measures put in place to ensure survivors get set up towards reporting GBV cases and seeking justice.

title.narrative: Improved multisectoral coordination and monitoring of SGBV in Kilifi and Meru Counties.

Public authorities (Police and local administration) in Kilifi and Meru Counties have been equipped with knowledge and skills to improve institutional response and prevention of violence against women and girls. This has been made effective through technical working group convenings, dissemination of standard operating procedures at the police stations. The state and non-state actors have harmonized efforts to ensure survivors of gender-based violence are linked and referred to access GBV services and as a result, they also ensure justice is served.

description.narrative: Type and nature of coordination measures put in place for example technical working group meetings, functional standard operating procedures for the police, effective flowing information systems, and participatory participation in budgetary allocation meetings at the county level.

title.narrative: Nature of coordination measures put in place to ensure improved multi-sectoral coordination.

description.narrative: This is the type of coordination measures put in place, for example, technical working groups meetings, dissemination of GBV standard operating procedures to the police stations that support improving service delivery and support to survivors.

target.value: 8 quarterly multi sectoral county and sub county GBV technical working group meetings.

comment.narrative: Conduct quarterly county and sub county technical working group meetings.

actual.value: Three Technical working group meetings were held with 100 participants, 54 males and 49 females. The TWG members were able t develop a constitution and terms of reference to govern the operations of the stakeholders of the county. Collaborations were enhanced with the aim of eliminating GBV in the community by strengthening the GBV referral pathway. The TWG members developed a toolkit which was used to initiate an efficient reporting system, it enabled the TWG members to collect accurate data.

comment.narrative: There was improved coordination where stakeholders worked collectively towards eradicating GBV in the community by strengthening the GBV referral pathway.

target.value: 4 women led accountability groups participates in decision making platforms including public participation forums (virtual or physical) at county level

dimension.name: One lobbying meeting was held . During the meeting Women group leaders gave feedback on the conducted GBV community sensitizations meetings by sharing experiences on handling GBV related cases in their respective area of operation . During the meeting gaps were identified in GBV reporting channels and discussions on the possible mitigations
dimension.value: One lobbying meeting was held with 18 participants, 17 female and 1 male

comment.narrative: During the meeting, Women group leaders gave feedback on the conducted GBV community sensitizations meetings by sharing experiences on handling GBV related cases in their respective areas of operation. During the meeting, gaps were identified in GBV reporting channels and discussions on the possible mitigations

target.value: The project will carry out 8 quarterly multi sectoral County and Sub County GBV technical working group (TWG) engagement meetings . 4 in Kilifi and 4 in Meru

dimension.name: Two county GBV technical working group meetings were supported. The meetings engaged 95 participants, 38 male and 57 female stakeholders from the county, including state and non-state actors.
dimension.value: Two county GBV technical working groups meeting were supported

comment.narrative: Joint efforts of state and non-state actors have harmonized efforts to ensure survivors are linked and referred to access GBV support services and are able to get justice.

target.value: 16 Quarterly Court Users Committee Meetings in Magistrates courts supported.

dimension.name: Support 16 Quarterly Court Users Committee Meetings in Magistrates courts and influence adjudication of sexual and gender based violence to use survivor centered approaches in adjudicating cases of SGBV
dimension.value: 16 Quarterly Court Users Committee Meetings in Magistrates courts supported.

comment.narrative: The meeting engaged 61 committee , 40male and 21 female. 1 Court Users Committee Members training was also conducted with 17 participants, 13 male, and 4 female. The meeting engaged stakeholders from the judiciary, probation, ODPP, NPS, MOH, childrens department, religious leaders, and other non-state actors of GBV, multi-sectoral approach towards dealing with SGBV cases.

target.value: 2 international calendar events

comment.narrative: Support international calendar events on GBV

actual.value: One calendar event was conducted reaching 300 girls.

comment.narrative: CREAW supported commemoration of the African child's day where the girls were sensitized on child rights and responsibilities.

target.value: 8 radio shows to be held in vernacular

comment.narrative: The radio shows were used as a platform to create awareness on GBV and GBV referral pathway.

actual.value: 9 radio shows were conducted reaching 900,000 listeners on information regarding gender equality and prevention and detection of sexual violence.

comment.narrative: Increased awareness and improved knowledge on GBV and GBV referral pathways.

target.value: Conduct 40 community dialogues

comment.narrative: The community conversations in the 40 villages were to encourage non violent resolution of conflict between intimate partners as well as facilitate survivor support for those living in far reach areas.

actual.value: 20 community forums were held reaching 181 male and 597 female.

comment.narrative: The community forums focused on sensitizing the community on the importance of reporting GBV cases and encourage women to seek justice by referring them to legal and counseling services offered by CREAW.

comment.narrative: Conduct community conversations led by community-led accountability groups encouraging nonviolent resolution of the conflict between intimate partners as well as facilitate survivor support for those living in far to reach areas

target.value: 1500 dignity kits provided to vulnerable women and girls in Kilifi and Meru

dimension.name: 1500 dignity kits to be issued to survivors of violence in Kilifi and Meru counties

comment.narrative: The dignity kits are aimed to support women and girls who are between 12- 19 years of age and are survivors of violence.

target.value: Hold 8 radio and TV shows using community media stations in Kilifi and Meru including those that use vernacular language to communicate.

comment.narrative: The radio shows is to create awareness to the community members on discussing GBV matters, women leadership, and gender equality

target.value: Support 20 community led accountability groups to hold 40 community conversations in 40 villages encouraging nonviolent resolution of conflict between intimate partners as well as facilitate survivor support for those living in far to reach areas.

dimension.name: Community dialogues conversations were conducted by community led accountability groups encouraging nonviolent resolution of conflict between intimate partners as well as facilitate survivor support for those living in far to reach areas.
dimension.value: 47 community conversations were conducted, reaching 2110 community members, 1360 female and 50 male

actual.value: One international day event supported in Kilifi and Meru counties

comment.narrative: CREAW supported the International women's day on 08th March 2021, whose theme was-WOMEN IN LEADERSHIP; ACHIEVING AN EQUAL FUTURE IN COVID 19 WORLD. The commemoration involved celebrating ten women who are in leadership positions at the grassroots level who were selected by the members of the gender TWG were celebrated and awarded medallions by the governor for their work during the COVID 19 pandemic. The day was also celebrated by prisoners serving sentences and remandees at the womes prison, the women were trained on how to protect themselves and respond to GBV.

actual.value: 1000 dignity kits were distributed to adolescents young girls and mothers aged between 12-19years.

comment.narrative: Dignity kits were distributed to vulnerable women and girls in Kilifi and Meru as a stop-gap measure in ensuring menstrual hygiene during the COVID 19 pandemic

dimension.name: Community conversations aimed to reach many community members with GBV information and enhance skills in reporting and referral of GBV cases.

comment.narrative: The conversations were conducted by community-led accountability groups encouraging nonviolent resolution of the conflict between intimate partners as well as facilitate survivor support for those living in far-to-reach areas.

actual.value: Four radio talk shows with a reach of 1,4000,000 were conducted to create awareness to the community members on discuss GBV matters, women leadership and gender equality

target.value: Provide 1500 dignity kits to vulnerable women and girls in Kilifi and Meru.

actual.value: 1000 dignity kits were distributed to vulnerable women and girls

comment.narrative: The dignity kits restored dignity and confidence of the women and girls who were adversely affected the impacts of COVID 19.

target.value: Four murals with information on the referral pathway .

comment.narrative: the murals have information on the GBV referral pathway and contact information on GBV comprehensive cares services for SGBV survivors.
The mural created awareness on the GBV referral pathways and contact information of where to get the services.

title.narrative: Public authorities (Police and local administration) in Kilifi and Meru Counties are equipped with knowledge and skills to improve institutional response and prevention of violence against women and girls.

description.narrative: Sensitization of police officers, chiefs, and assistant chiefs to improve their knowledge in offering support to survivors and in handling GBV cases.

title.narrative: Total number of local administrators and the police equipped with the knowledge and skills to improve institutional response and prevention of GBV

description.narrative: A total of 355 local administrators 236male, 119 female, 68 police officers( 33female, 68male) were sensitized on matters regarding GBV, how they can support survivors, and the GBV reporting channels. From the sensitization meetings: There has been increased awareness of the community and local administrators on matters regarding GBV and the whereby the county commanders committed to mobilize and support police training on GBV. There is a significant change of the cultural norms where men are now in the frontline on eradicating GBV and improved service deliveries to GBV survivors, especially in police stations.

target.value: 24 sensitizations forums to be held in police stations and sub county police stations.

comment.narrative: Sensitizations forums aimed at increasing the knowledge on police officers on handling GBV matters.

actual.value: 13 sensitizations forums were held in police stations reaching 399 police officers, 273 male and 126 female.

comment.narrative: During the sensitization meetings, the police officers were able to identify gaps in their engagement to assist GBV survivors to seek justice. The police Officers were able to work collaboratively with other stakeholders especially on handling children matters where they worked collaboratively with the children's office department to rescue children who have been abused by close family members.

target.value: Conduct Sensitization forums in 24 police stations/sub county stations on how to intervene, investigate and prevent cases of SGBV. (24 forums at police station)

comment.narrative: The number of trainings conducted in police stations to create awareness on how to handle GBV cases and support survivors of violence.

dimension.name: 16 sensitization forums held in both Kilifi and Meru counties reaching 639 ( 432 male and 207 female) officials of the local administration .There was improved knowledge amongst chiefs and sub chiefs on how to efficiently protect, respond and prevent GBV incidences in the communities.

target.value: Sensitization meetings with local administration( chiefs and assistant chiefs).

dimension.name: Sensitization meetings with the 36 chiefs and assistant chiefs in Meru and Kilifi counties during their baraza forums
dimension.value: A total of 355 local administrators 236male, 119 female, 68 police fofficers( 33female, 68male) were sensitized on matters regarding GBV, how they can support survivors and the GBV reporting channels. From the sensitization meetings:

comment.narrative: As a result of the sensitization meetings, There has been increased awareness of the community and local administrators on matters regarding GBV and the whereby the county commanders committed to mobilize and support police training on GBV.

target.value: Three lobbying meetings were held with the sub county commanders. There is continued support by the sub county commanders to continue training police on National Police Service Standard Operating Procedures on gender based violence. The county commanders issued vehicles to accompany GBV survivors to hospitals for medical assessments to be conducted as well as GBV related emergencies.

dimension.name: One on one lobbying meeting with the County commander, sub-county commander and the officers commanding targeted police stations.

comment.narrative: Meetings with the county commander, sub county commanders and officers commanding stations at the subcounty levels were conducted to lobby for an opportunity to sensitize the officers on how to protect and intervene GBV cases during their briefing meeting.

target.value: 96 police officers sensitized and equipped with knowledge and skills regarding GBV

dimension.name: Sensitization of police officers on how to intervene, prevent cases of SGBV
dimension.value: 68 police officers sensitized. 33 female and 68 male

comment.narrative: Sensitization meetings were conducted in police stations in order to equip the police with knowledge in handling SGBV cases and in supporting GBV survivors

target.value: Conduct Sensitization forums in 24 police stations/sub county stations on how to intervene, investigate and prevent cases of SGBV. (24 forums at police station)

dimension.name: Sensitization meetings held in Meru and Kilifi counties
dimension.value: Four sensitization meetings were conducted engaging 101 police officers 68male and 33 females

comment.narrative: The aim of the forum was to equip the officers with knowledge and skills on GBV related laws, policies, and efficient ways of handling GBV survivors/cases. Charges on the PRC were one of the challenges expressed during the sensitizations.I

actual.value: One lobbying meeting held with 18 participants, 17 female and 1 male. During the meeting Women group leaders gave feedback on the conducted GBV community sensitizations meetings by sharing experiences on handling GBV related cases in their respective area of operation
